Origins: On 3 December 2014, the web site Naha Daily published an article titled "Timberland CEO: 'I'd Rather Not See Blacks in My Boots.'" That article skipped between quoting Timberland's CEO and the company's "Senior Marketing VP of the Timberland boot brand":
Description: However, Naha Daily identifies its content as "completely fictional " and "based off current events in urban culture and entertainment." Among previous efforts on the site are articles titled "Police Dog Wins Medal for Killing Ferguson Protester" and "Cop Shoots 1Yr Old Black Baby After Mistaking Pacifier for Gun." The claim mirrored an older false rumor that Timberland is owned by the Ku Klux Klan.
Example: [Collected via e-mail, December 2014] The new appointed Timberland Ceo lost it at a earnings press conference and revealed that he'd rather not see Blacks and Latinos in his boots
Claim: Timberland's CEO said he doesn't want black people to wear Timberland boots.
